qas.question: How much of Dell's revenue was its PC division?
Who was Dell's main business rival?
How much did Dell spend on acquiring different divisions?
What happened to Dell's revenue and share price in the post-PC market?
How much of Dell's revenue wasn't its PC division?
How much of Dell's revenue was its phone division?
Who was Dell's main business ally?
How much did Dell spend on selling different divisions?
What happened to Dell's expenses and share price in the post-PC market?

context: Dell has been attempting to offset its declining PC business, which still accounted for <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>half<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> of its revenue and generates steady cash flow, by expanding into the enterprise market with servers, networking, software, and services. It avoided many of the acquisition writedowns and management turnover that plagued its chief rival <a1_0><b6_0>Hewlett Packard<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Dell also managed some success in taking advantage of its high-touch direct sales heritage to establish close relationships and design solutions for clients. Despite spending <a2_0><b7_0>$13 billion<b7_0/><a2_0/> on acquisitions to diversify its portfolio beyond hardware, the company was unable to convince the market that it could thrive or made the transformation in the post-PC world, as it suffered continued <a3_0><b8_0>declines<b8_0/><a3_0/> in revenue and share price. Dell's market share in the corporate segment was previously a "moat" against rivals but this has no longer been the case as sales and profits have fallen precipitously.
